content.question: The Bohr model of the hydrogen atom proposed that the waves of the orbiting electron form a standing wave pattern. Which of the following describes the application of this model that led to discrete energy levels for the atom?

choices.label: The energy of the electron depends on its mass and velocity, which together determine the energy of the states.
A whole number of wavelengths must fit in the circumference of the electron’s orbit, which limits the size of the orbit to certain values.
The physical size of the electron affects its energy and thus its de Broglie wavelength, which limits the number of possible energy states.
The ratio of the mass of the electron to that of the proton affects the electron’s energy and thus its de Broglie wavelength, which limits the number of possible energy states.

content.answer: A whole number of wavelengths must fit in the circumference of the electron’s orbit, which limits the size of the orbit to certain values.
